definitions.definition: a room used for a special or official purpose, or a group of people who form (part of) a parliament:
examples: Meetings of the council are held in the council chamber.

definitions.definition: a judge's private office. A judge may have legal discussions with lawyers in private in his or her chambers.
an office, especially of a person in an important position
If a trial is in chambers, it happens in a court room without the public, newspaper reporters, etc. being there.
